oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Synthesis review services support in Canadian academic libraries
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Boden, Catherine
Doi, Carolyn
Gerrard, Angie
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This dataset results from an online survey of Canadian academic libraries conducted by librarians at the University Library, University of Saskatchewan from May 2-16, 2018. The objectives of the survey were: 1. to describe synthesis review service models provided by Canadian academic libraries; 2. to understand the strengths, and challenges (and, where possible, solutions) of these models. A targeted sample of Canadian academic librarians was recruited via email distribution through discussion lists of the Canadian Health Libraries Association/Association des bibliothéques de la santé du Canada (CANMEDLIB), the Association of Faculties of Medicine of Canada Libraries Group (AFMCLIB), and the CARL Librarian Research Institute (LibrarianResCanL) listservs . The data are de-identified responses to the survey.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Computer and Information Science
Medicine, Health and Life Sciences
Social Sciences
Systematic reviews (Medical research)
Public services (Libraries)
